text: Ben Turbett (1874 – March 6, 1936) was an opera performer, actor, and film director in the United States. He was born in Salem, Massachusetts and performed in operas as a young man. In 1909 he appeared in the Broadway production Stubborn Cinderella. ==Filmography== ===Actor=== * The Blue Coyote Cherry Crop d'Ashley Miller (1914) * The Working of a Miracle d'Ashley Miller (1915) * The Corporal's Daughter de Will Louis (1915) * The Broken Word de Frank McGlynn Sr. (1915) ===Director=== * The Voice of the Violin (1915 film) (1915) * When Love Is King (1916) * Love Is King (1916) * The Last Sentence (1917 film) (1917) * The Royal Pauper (1917) * Builders of Castles (1917) * The Half Back (1917) * Gallegher (1917) * The Lady of the Photograph (1917) * Cy Whittaker's Ward (1917) * The Courage of the Common Place (1917) * The Lady of the Photograph (1917) * The Courage of the Common Place (1917) ==References== Category:Male actors from Massachusetts Category:Film directors from Massachusetts Category:20th-century American opera singers Category:20th- century American male musicians Category:20th-century American male actors Category:American male singers Category:American male stage actors Category:American male silent film actors Category:1874 births Category:1936 deaths Category:People from Salem, Massachusetts Category:20th-century male singers
